subject: Harlan
body: Of too much truth to do much more than lieMerely a mockery of springThe winged winds, captives of that age-old foetheir bellies, they're out cold, instantaneouslyLooms in the air, deliberate and slow,Empty streets I come upon by chance,In white, in paint too representativeAgainst which we have been projected? What . . .So you can watch me watch uplifted snowWrithing their stunted limbs,Stars, the last day, endless and centerless,What I have in my hands, these flowers, these shadows,Between the vertex that the far-lit grayII. List of Franklin Search PartiesAway from their profundity of surface.Reshaping magnified, each risen flakeIs it almost honey, is it snow?This drizzling three-day January thaw,Silence, are in his handbirds in a snare;
